p: Some conclusions can be drawn by analysing the in vivo phenotypes of re-encoded viruses in light of the sequencing data obtained from infected hamsters liver samples (see details in TableÂ 5). For example, the sequences obtained from the livers of hamsters infected with the control strain Ap7M did not include consensus mutations. This indicates that the sequence of the parent virus was stable under the experimental conditions and that adaptative mutations were not required for efficient replication in vivo.
